entry.title: bert
entry.content:
https://arxiv.org/pdf/1810.04805.pdf

Abstract

bert Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers

transformers

Encoder transformers Encoder-Decoder Bidirectional

transformers

Encoder Multi-Head Attention + MLP

ELMo gpt bertELMo RNNberttransformers

Intro

bertNLP

  • ELMo RNN
  • gpt

()general language representations

  • masked language model (MLM)

The masked language model randomly masks some of the tokens from the input, and the objective is to predict the original vocabulary id of the masked arXiv:1810.04805v2 [cs.CL] 24 May 2019 word based only on its context.

  • next sentence prediction

bert

transformer

meaning
Lnumber of layers Transformer blocks
Hhidden size
A

BERTBASE (L=12, H=768, A=12, Total Parameters=110M) and BERTLARGE (L=24, H=1024, A=16, Total Parameters=340M)

entry.title: transformer
entry.content:
https://arxiv.org/pdf/2205.13504.pdf

transformer >

Abstract

LTSF long-term time series forecasting

LSTFtransformer

transformer

transoformer self-attention

permutation-invariant and anti-order to some extent. self-attention

transformer

7

  • Can existing LTSF-Transformers extract temporal relations well from longer input sequences?

step transformer mse

  • What can be learned for long-term forecasting?

Table 3. Comparison of different input sequences under the MSE metric to explore what LTSF-Transformers depend on. If the input is Close, we use the 96th, , 191th time steps as the input sequence. If the input is Far, we use the 0th, , 95th time steps. Both of them forecast the 192th, ,(192 + 720)th time steps.

9696MSE

Transformer

  • Are the self-attention scheme effective for LTSF?

Att.-Linear linear

mse

  • Can existing LTSF-Transformers preserve temporal order well?

transformer

  • How effective are different embedding strategies?

(wo/Pos.)Informer (wo/Temp.)InformerInformerFEDformer Autoformer Autoformer FEDformer /

  • Is training data size a limiting factor for existing LTSFTransformers?

  • Is efficiency really a top-level priority?

Transformer Transformer Transformer

PEWindowsPEWindows

IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER329

  • MagicIMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER3210BIMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER6420B
  • AddressOfEntryPointEPRVA
  • ImageBase3207FFFFFFF
  • SectionAlignment,FileAlignment
  • SizeOfImagePE Image
  • SizeOfHeadersPE
  • Subsystem
  • NumberOfRvaAndSizeDataDirectory
  • DataDirectoryIMAGE_DATA_DIRECTORY

  • .text: Contains the executable code of the program.
  • .data: Contains the initialized data.
  • .bss: Contains uninitialized data.
  • .rdata: Contains read-only initialized data.
  • .edata: Contains the export tables.
  • .idata: (IAT), IAT
  • .reloc: Contains image relocation information.
  • .rsrc: Contains resources used by the program, these include images, icons or even embedded binaries.
  • .tls: (Thread Local Storage), provides storage for every executing thread of the program.

PE .rsrc, .data, .rdata ,
